data.title: Changes for MaskNodeHandsOff
data.body:
This is a rework of the Pull Request
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/453 based on my own
understanding of the issue.  The details may be found in my comments
in the original Pull Request (#453).

data.title: Oculus Rift Sensor Data Comparison Change
data.body:
- Modified OculusVRSensorData::compare() to only work with the raw
  sensor data when specifically requested.  No need to process those
  values if the user hasn't asked for them.

data.title: Visual Studio 2013 compatibility changes.
data.body: These fix two of the three issues reported in issue #498

data.title: Visual Studio 2013 compatibility
data.body:
There are a couple of errors when compiling with Visual Studio 2013.
1. Microsoft now defines strtof in their standard library. This conflicts with stringFunctions.h strtof define.
2. The dae library file daeElement.cpp is unable to find a function definition for max. This can be temp. fixed by including algorithm and changing the call to std::max.
3. For some strange reason, the compiler has an issue with RenderInstType's copy ctor throwing a C2535 'already defined' error. Best fix seems to remove the default parameter on the cctor and define a default ctor.

data.title: Oculus Rift Improvements
data.body:
- Now requires OVR SDK 0.2.5
- New chromatic aberration correction shader.  Can be disabled by
  setting $pref::OculusVR::UseChromaticAberrationCorrection to false prior
  to enabling Rift display (such as for screen shots).
- FXAA on by default when using full screen on the Rift.
- Can now manually override IPD from script.  Otherwise value set in
  profile is used.
- Raw sensor data now available through input events (set
  $OculusVR::GenerateSensorRawEvents to true) and console methods.  The
  raw data is acceleration, angular velocity, and magnetometer reading.
- Can determine if magnetometer calibration data is available using a
  console method in order to notify the user.

data.title: Change default damage and white flash
data.body:
Change both the damage flash and white out values to return 0 by
default.  This prevents a damage flash or white out from displaying for
GameBase derived classes that don't override these methods.  From
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/395

data.title: action tactics template
data.body: Action Tactics Hybrid Game Template

data.title: Mounted image weapon light fix
data.body:
Fix for mounted image lights beyond the first weapon light.  Before this
fix all mounted images that have lights would not function if mounted to
a slot after a mounted image that uses a weapon light.

data.title: Ubuntu 64 compile Error
data.body:
When trying to run 'make release' on 64bit Ubuntu (13.04), I come across an error:

> usr/include/c++/4.7/bits/stl_algobase.h:60:28: fatal error: bits/c++config.h: No such >file or directory

Upon searching for a solution, I found that I needed to run:

> sudo apt-get install gcc-4.7-multilib g++-4.7-multilib

Now I receive an error later in the compile process, but downloading those packages removed my immediate error.

The new error is:

> ../../../../Engine/source/main/main.cpp:252:31: fatal error: platform/platform.h: No >such file or directory

data.title: TSMesh::castRay() and small collision meshes
data.body:
When working with smallish collision meshes (soccer ball sized) the `TSMesh::castRay()` can fail even though there should be a collision.  The reason ends up being because the convex hull is never generated in `TSMesh::buildConvexHull()` due to `TSMesh::addToHull()` thinking that there is no plane.

It turns out that this may already be solved by John Carroll here: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/60557

data.title: ShapeBaseData::damage() wrong parameters
data.body:
In server/shapeBase.cs the `ShapeBaseData::damage()` method is defined.  This is the default method when a ShapeBase object takes damage and it current does nothing.  However, its parameters are wrong which would confuse someone that uses it as a base for their own method.  Currently it looks like this:

```
function ShapeBaseData::damage(%this, %obj, %position, %source, %amount, %damageType)
```

It should look like this:

```
function ShapeBaseData::damage(%this, %obj, %source, %position, %amount, %damageType)
```

with the `%source` and `%position` parameters swapped.  The reason for this change is because this Datablock damage method is called from `ShapeBase::damage()` in the same file and the parameter order is defined there.

data.title: Gamepad and joystick dead zone fix
data.body:
Fix for gamepad and joystick dead zone calculation so that the
calculated value will always fall within the 0..1 range.  In reference
to https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/468

data.title: DecalManager scene container fix
data.body:
In reference to https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/474 this
is a general fix for all global bounds objects.

data.title: AiPlayer Poses
data.body: Allows AiPlayer to use player poses and also fixes an issue with them not updating on the client.

data.title: Ai Poses Update / Fix
data.body: This code allows AiPlayer to uses poses like the Player can. It also fixes an issue with AiPlayers not updating their pose animations on the client.

data.title: Custom GUI Profile/Files issue

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: Saving and reloading issues with Custom GUI profiles and default .gui files, using ~~consolefuncrefactor branch.~~ development branch (merge happened).

data.title: Make GuiShapeNameHud frame and fill rendering useful
data.body: At the moment, the `fill` and `frame` colours of `GuiShapeNameHud` fill the entire hud area. Which doesn't seem helpful. These changes make the full and outlines happen around each shape name that is rendered. Which AFAIR is how it worked in TGE.

data.title: Allow audioData.cs.dso to execute
data.body: When using only compiled scripts, the isFile( "./audioData.cs" ) would fail for audioData.cs.dso causing none of the audio data to load.  The correct method is to use isScriptFile(), along with a fully qualified file path, to check for either the .dso or .cs files.

data.title: Var rename fix460
data.body: Fixes a mismatched variable name introduced in pr#460

data.title: A few fixes for generating projects on *nix platform.
data.body:
This PR fixes Issue #473 and does rename all the .command files to .sh to be more confirming to *nix.
It took me a while before i found out that the .command files was *nix related.
I also added a toplevel generateAllProjects.sh equivalent  with the windows bat script to generate all projects specified in allProjects.txt.

Developed and tested on Fedora 19. And what I could find out /bin/bash is also available on Mac OSX so it shouldn't break but needs to be verified.

data.title: DecalManager not in proper scene container
data.body:
There is an issue with the DecalManager not being put into the correct scene container, which is known as the overflow bin for global objects like this.  It had to do with its bounds not being set up correctly before being added to the client scene graph.  However, I believe that the correct fix is to change the logic in SceneContainer::insertIntoBins() to completely ignore the object bounds when the object has been explicitly set as a global one.

The discussion of this issue and a possible fix may be found in the following forum post:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134804

data.title: PHP class name clash with Generator class.
data.body: PHP >=5.5.0 introduced a new class named Generator which name clashes with the generator class of projectGenerator.

data.title: Spinning spot lights are culled improperly
data.body:
Spot lights using the spinning animation will stop rendering when they should still be within view because their bounding box is inaccurate.

 I've explained the problem more thoroughly and provided a rough fix, here: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134754
